text: Alizé Cornet was the defending champion, but lost in the final to Fiona Ferro, won her first career WTA Tour singles title, defeating Cornet in the final, 6–1, 2–6, 6–1. ==Seeds== Note: Anastasia Potapova, who entered late and played in the qualifying tournament, would have been seeded 7th if she had entered the tournament prior to the initial entry cutoff date of 3 June 2019. ==Draw== ===Finals=== ===Top half=== ===Bottom half=== ==Qualifying== ===Seeds=== ===Qualifiers=== ===Lucky losers=== ===Draw=== ====First Qualifier==== ====Second Qualifier==== ====Third Qualifier==== ====Fourth Qualifier==== ====Fifth Qualifier==== ====Sixth Qualifier==== ==References== ==Sources== *Main Draw *Qualifying Draw Ladies Open Lausanne Category:WTA Swiss Open
title: 2019 Ladies Open Lausanne – Singles
